summary: The Northern Montana Water Security Act of 2025 addresses water rights claims of the Fort Belknap Indian Community, ratifying a water rights compact and authorizing land exchanges. It provides funding for irrigation project rehabilitation and expansion, wastewater facilities for the Blackfeet Tribe, and a storage allocation from Lake Elwell. The bill includes provisions for tribal water rights, land transfers, and a trust fund for the Fort Belknap Indian Community, aiming to settle water disputes and improve infrastructure. The bill also includes an authorization for funding community water distribution and wastewater treatment facilities for the Blackfeet Tribe.
